Had paris brest - surprising it is made of pistachio and peanut butter. I have never been a peanut butter fan but their paris brest made me want to indulge their peanut butter flavor.

And all the other stuff look very good. I love the texture of almond croissant and chocolate one is cripsy 

Service: 5$ min for credit card...

overall: good!I am glad that this place exists in Pitt

Whether I'm getting this from the bakery or from 21st Street Coffee it always impresses me! 
Be prepared to wait in line in Lawrenceville, but it's 100% worth it!!!

Stopped by here on my way home to Baltimore. It was mid-day and their display was already almost empty, which tells me 1. their items are fresh since they go through inventory a lot and 2. people love their food! I bought four different croissants (thankful for the recommendations the employee gave me) and traveled on my way. When I go home, my family and I sampled them and they were still fresh! They were all delicious and flaky and irresistible! I can't wait to go back on my next trip and try their other products!

Wish I could say it was a nice experience but it was not. I walked in on a very slow day ,most days I walk past it's so busy I don't bother because I don't like to wait. I walk in the door and see a young girl behind the counter no more then 3 feet from me. She didn't lift her head to look at me to even make eye contact. I decided to just walk the 4 feet to the other person standing by the register and she smiled and assisted me . I could not help but notice the girl that ignored me still standing at the same spot when a girl very similar in look walked in . The girl that ignored me seemed to light up when the saw the girl walk in and jumped at the chance to offer assistance to her with a smile. Just a point of reference, I am a 64 year old white man and the girl behind the counter was in her 20s with tattoos and piercings. The girl that walked in after me was a girl in her 20s with tattoos and piercings. I have been in this earth more then both theses girls combined ages so I do know when I am being ignored. If you are incapable of dealing with all types of people you should not work in a retail outlet. Leave your hang ups at home or better yet just stay home.
An extraordinary little way to treat yourself. Flavorful and satisfying treats bring me back to my childhood as a bakers family.

Marvelous French bakery in the heart of Lawrenceville. Everything is authentic and delicious. 

The lines are often quite long, especially on a Saturday morning, and sometimes they run out of the things I'm looking to buy.

The staff is friendly and helpful. Definitely a fun place to shop.
I will be a Pittsburgh unit in no time.  there isn't a dessert that I don't enjoy from this place.  I go get a different dessert every time.

Sacré bleu!  La Gourmandine is so amazing, I'm going to have to use some fancy French words to do it justice.

Who would have thought a bakery, much less a bakery in Central Larryville, may be one (if not THE) best in city?  I especially enjoy the Le Campagnard lunch special - 6 bucks and change for a delicious baguette with turkey and cheese, including a drink.  You can pay that amount and get bread baked in a toaster oven down the street at Jared's Sandwich Shop and wait in line for 25 min. to eat that delicacy, or pop on in to La Gourmandine for fresh French bread that will fill you up even better.

Ah, always the pièce de résistance of my La Gourmandine experiences, the Marquise.  I love Crème Brulee, and this delicious (and LARGE) pastry combines that with crispy caramel and dark chocolate mouse.  It melts in my mouth.  The ladies that work at LG make me giggle when they ask if I'd like it placed in a box for later....I'm lucky if it makes it till I get home! 

Speaking of the LG ladies, the staff there is very friendly, even when dealing with large crowds.  The busiest times seem to be weekend mornings.  I never have a wait when I stop by during weekday lunch hours.

A BIG merci beaucoup to La Gourmandine, a taste of Paris right here in our own Hipster Paradise.

This is the real deal. Go! The pastries are legit. And the bread delicious. I mean this place is like stepping into a neighborhood patisserie in France. I've tried the pain chocolate. The Bouche de Noel. And the country loaf bread. I will be coming back here every time I need bread and a French pastry!

I love French pastries and I didn't expect to find one here. Not too sweet, light, and delicate.


Update 8/22/2015:

Came for the second time, and once again not disappointed! Actually, that's an understatement, since I simply love the pastries here. Although my love for macarons tempted me to get a lemon flavored one (just one!), I tried new desserts this time, including the flan. I do not regret finishing off every last crumb of it!
I also purchased a baguette, 2 croissants, and an almond croissant for our breakfast tomorrow morning. Because, come on, how can you resist those freshly baked bread??

But I must warn you: after coming here twice, I learned an important lesson. To be able to have the most options available, come early morning if possible. These breads/pastries sell out quick!

And I have to mention how lovely the staff are. They are always friendly and full of smiles. It makes this place even more irresistible. Oh La Gourmadine, please don't make me bankrupt on your goods (or fat). :P
Very good and very friendly! One of the workers there was from France so we felt it was so authentic. I really enjoy the croissants for breakfast. Definitely will be back.
This is a gem in Pittsburgh. Its so awesome it has no equal. I feel guilty every time I go here that I don't frequent it more often. Seriously why don't I have their bread on hand at all times.
Best macaroon i have ever had.  Hands down.  Strawberry rhubarb was to die for.  I had to keep myself from crawling back for more.

The best french macaroons!
This is the go to place for french macaroons. A line out the door is common so order ahead and come early. Large selection of flavors. The large cream and raspberry ones are my favorite.

This place is absolutely, mind-blowing, unbelievable!  I lived for a brief stint in Paris (pah-ree), and this is as if a wonderful Paris boulangerie set it's digs in Pittsburgh.  It's spot on!  You must give this place a try, you won't be sorry.  I'm not lying when I say that I adore everything they offer, seriously it's all good, you can't go wrong. here.  DH ordered  me a specialty raspberry mousse cake for my birthday (isn't he the best, i just love him) it was to die for!!!  But my absolute favorite item on their menu is the pain au chocolate because it's how it should be, the perfect amount of chocolate (the fancy kind), and the buttery croissant crust.... oh yeah baby.

I am a weekly patron here at this point. Sometimes twice weekly! I started with the Lawrenceville location and absolutely loved it - when I found out there was one closer to me, I was very excited.

My typical weekly buy is the Macaron aux Fruits - a large macaron filled with lychee cream and raspberries. It is DIVINE! 

Other treats that I've tried:

Choux à la crème - this was great for a very light sweet treat. Airy pastry with a very light cream filling. 

Dèlice de pistache - I was very excited to try this one as I normally love pistachio anything. I was not a big fan of the choux dough combined with the pistachio cream, but the cream itself was lovely.

Choquettes - these little guys are great for small treats. Tasty dough that is similar to a donut and dusted with sugar, and you get a dozen for $3!

Vegetarian quiche - I'm not well versed in the world of quiches but I was not a big fan of this. I think goat cheese is probably a love it or hate it thing, and I was not a fan of this. Would still like to try the other quiche with the bacon though!

Marquis - Rich, chocolatey, and definitely indulgent!

Mouelleux au chocolat - Very rich and very delicious! Kind of like a chocolate lava cake but far better than anything you'd get at Applebee's. 

Fraisiers - delightful little sponge cakes, perfect for a sweet snack

Small macarons - So far, I've been 50/50 with the ones I've tried. I like the pink and purple ones. 

Forget the name, but the pumpkin tart is easily the best tasting pumpkin dessert I've ever had. 

Additionally, I'm not sure where they get their coffee, but it's very good. It never tastes burnt and is always fresh, and the flavor is wonderful.

I had been wanting to visit this place since moving to Pittsburgh but am rarely in Lawrenceville. When on a thrifting trip with a friend who lives in the area, she suggested we make a stop there. I was really excited to try it out based on reviews and photos. 

As soon as you walk in it smells amazing. The staff are friendly and the service is fast. I ordered a tartelette aux framboises and was not disapppinted. The crust was delicious and perfectly baked. The raspberry filling and vanilla cream topping were perfect. I had a bite of my friend's macaron aux framboises as well and almost wished I had grabbed one of those, as even though my own treat was amazing, I enjoyed hers even more. 

Next time I am DEFINITELY trying out the delice de pistache!

I came home sick from a vacation, and all I immediately wanted were these pastries.  Abricotine is fantastic in the morning with coffee, the pan aux chocolat is to die for heated up with all that melting chocolate, there's an apple pastry that is like the abricotine that I can't remember the name of, but is equally delicious, and finally, the choux a la creme -- oh my god.  You'll never leave disappointed.  Everything is fresh, and mouth watering.  I had to stop myself from going in AGAIN today...

One of my favorite places! I do not go as often as I should... which is probably a good thing, because every time I am there I want everything they have. It's not a big place at all, and not somewhere I would go to sit down and enjoy my pastries, but somewhere I would pick something up to eat as I'm walking to my car because I can't wait to try it. 

One of my favorite things to get is the quiche. I like just about every kind they make! There is just something about it that I look forward to so much. Another thing I love (which I don't know the cool french name for) is a pastry with chocolate chips and some sort of vanilla custard-y filling. It's just. so. good. 

My most recent experience was on the day before Thanksgiving when just about everyone is picking up desserts and pies. I expected to walk in and it be stressful and overwhelming, but it was in fact the best way to start my day. The employees were buzzing around behind the counters like busy bees, helping each person with a warm smile on their faces. They also kept bringing out small trays of samples and putting them on the top of the counter so everyone in line could try different things. I had about 5 or 6 different items just while waiting to pay. It's as if they just knew the way to my heart... free samples of delicious food. 

I've had breads, pies, cakes, pastries, quiche, coffee and it's all been wonderful and I'd say very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend this place for delicious, high quality, and unique items!

Stopped in the bakery today around 9:30 am. Did not have to wait. Couple siting outside the bakery having some pastries and coffee. Went inside the bakery and was greeted by a friendly staff member. There were a variety of goodies that I could not pronounce, but the lady explained each item I pointed at. Before I knew it, I had a box of bake items to take home at a reasonable price. There isn't any seating inside. There is a noticed posted on the wall explaining why they don't have seating and apologizing. Seems that if the bakery had seating, it would be considered a restaurant. As its a bakery, therefore no seating. There wouldn't be much room for seating if it was offered. The items I bought and tasted were delicious. Its a nice little place.
I go there regularly...always delicious and fresh.... One place in town that isn't over hyped.

Put in in my mouth. 
Put in in your mouth. 
I said my big hungry mouth.
I said your big hungry mouth. 
I just want to eat them all. 
You will want to eat them all. 
Cause all of those croissants just melt. 
As soon as they hit your mouth. 

You won't just need one. 
You are going to need two. 
Or three, or four. Then you'll be coming back for some more. 

This place is so good, stop wasting time reading Yelp reviews and go get in line. Buy everything you can get your hands on today.  This is where real craft and talent shine. And your personal preference is all up to your mouth & belly. Let your taste buds guide you. Just don''t make the mistake of not getting enough!  Strategize when you order. Things sell out quickly and you WILL get home and vividly fantasize about what had been in your mouth earlier in the day. Just order everything at once. What you will be shoving in your face right now. What you will be shoving in your face later. Possibly what you will want to be shoving in your face really, really later.  

Trust me on this one.
